title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 4 cheeseburgers and 5 units of Good J will maximize Andrew’s total benefit given his weekly income of $65 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of cheeseburgers (1) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good J (1), or

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Andrew would not be able to buy 5 cheeseburgers and 6 units of Good J and/or does not explain that his total expenditures would be $80 ( =$10×5+$5×6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi abg2da9iaacscacaaIXaGaaGimaiabgEna0kaaiwdacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGynaiabgEna0kaaiAdaaaa@4437@ ), which is greater than his weekly income of $75.

The response states that no, , Andrew would not be able to buy 5 cheeseburgers and 6 units of Good J and explains that his total expenditures would be $80 ( =$10×5+$5×6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi abg2da9iaacscacaaIXaGaaGimaiabgEna0kaaiwdacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGynaiabgEna0kaaiAdaaaa@4437@ ), which is greater than his weekly income of $75.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify that Good J and Good S are complements and/or does not explain that the cross-price elasticity of demand is negative because a 10% decrease in the price of Good J led to an 8% increase in the demand for Good S.

The response identifies that Good J and Good S are complements and explains that the cross-price elasticity of demand is negative because a 10% decrease in the price of Good J led to an 8% increase in the demand for Good S.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the quantity of cheeseburgers that will maximize Andrew’s total benefit will increase and/or does not explain that a decrease in the price of an input to production will increase the supply of cheeseburgers, which will decrease the price of cheeseburgers and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent for each additional unit consumed.

The response states that the quantity of cheeseburgers that will maximize Andrew’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the price of an input to production will increase the supply of cheeseburgers, which will decrease the price of cheeseburgers and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent for each additional unit consumed.
